title: The CCD Celebrates Winning Over 30 Awards after Securing a Hat-Trick at the MIMA AwardsTravelandtourworld.com
text:
The CCD Celebrates Winning Over 30 Awards after Securing a Hat-Trick at the MIMA Awards  
The Convention Centre Dublin (The CCD) scooped three awards at the UK Meetings Industry Marketing Awards (MIMA), winning gold for ‘Best Integrated Marketing Campaign’, silver for ‘Best Print Advertising Campaign’ and bronze for ‘Best Website’.
 
Speaking after the awards, Elaine Phillips, Head of Marketing and Communications at The CCD said, “We are absolutely delighted to have been recognised by our peers in the events industry for our marketing campaigns and fully-responsive website. Our integrated campaign, ‘We’ve got the whole package’, designed by Dublin-based agency, Principle, used a visual and creative approach to deliver key messages to our audience of UK and European buyers, and was integrated across all our activity, with print and online advertising complemented by direct and digital marketing.”
 
The annual awards, which were held at the QEII Centre in London last Friday 9th October, were launched in 2002 by Meetings & Incentive Travel magazine, to raise the standards of marketing in the meetings and events industry and to recognise best practice in marketing.
 
The CCD has now received 31 industry awards in just over five years, including eight MIMAs for international marketing campaigns. Last month, the venue also won ‘Best Overseas Conference Venue’ at the UK C&IT Excellence Awards.
 
There were a number of other Irish winners on the night, including Fáilte Ireland who won silver for ‘Best Use of Video Marketing’, and Croke Park who won bronze for ‘Best Social Media Campaign’.
